page.title: 03The Church
page.content: The clock in the tower was put there as a memorial to the dead of the 1st World War. Several gravestones have been used to repair the church. These can be seen along the south wall over the windows. Presumably the stones came from the graveyard as there is a large patch of clear grass between the two gates. There is the stump of what was possibly once the village cross. This must have looked over the tiny village square. This is now a parking area. The wrought iron gates were made by the present village blacksmith. The graveyard has not been used for burials since the 1920s. People are now buried in the cemetery which is situated on Thorpe Rd. Money raised during the 800th anniversary celebrations of the Priory is to be used to repair the heating in the church.
